WRITING.TITLE: Damon "Stealing" Elena?!
WRITING.TEXT: Okay So whenever I go through Youtube Videos of DE and SE(mostly). People Often comment that Damon stole Elena from Stefan. What are your opinions on this? They quote "he made moves on her"and all that scenarios in Season 3 basically accusing him of taking advantage in the absence of Stefan. While I think it was mutual from both sides. What are your opinions on this?

WRITING.TITLE: Stefan saving Elena from drowning in (3x22)!!!
WRITING.TEXT: I have always had double thoughts on stefan respecting Elena's choice in their relationship ( which is very good,you should respect your partner). But when it comes to life and death,i think he should look at a bigger picture. I can let go off of 2x20 incident as she never wanted to became a Vampire so stefan knew that but in 3x22, shouldn't he have save Elena first?! The funny part is that he even regrets it thrice in the series discussing it with Damon(4x01),Elena(4x01) and Caroline in some episode of season 7 where he kidnaps her and quotes "You should respect people choice but not when it comes to life and death" and when caroline said "you gave that choice to elena so now i want that too" and then he says " And then I lost her". So Stefan did that so Elena doesn't get mad at him because he know elena would have been really upset if Matt died?! As Damon has once said that He ll make all their and death decisions while he worries about Collateral damage ie. sabotage thing in their relationship?!? What are you thoughts on this event. I always end up in a serious fight with people on this so maybe you guys can make me look at it differently.

WRITING.TITLE: Human Elena Vs Vampire Elena.
WRITING.TEXT: #8730; #8730;Just Wanted Opinions; I know a lot of people dislike/hate Vampire Elena ,the popular reasons being #8226; Crazy Obsession w/ Damon and handling Jeremy and her friends. #8226; That Mass Genocide (idk if it falls in hating Vampire Elena category). #8226;This conversation w/ Stefan seemed off and OOC to a lot of people (include me in it); [5.07] Elena: So, he's dead. It's over. Stefan: Yeah, it's over. Elena: Are you okay? Stefan: I'm fine. Elena: Look at me and tell me that killing Silas worked. That you'll be okay now. Stefan: Why is this so important to you? Elena: Because I know how much he stole from you. Stefan: Yeah, and he's dead. Elena: *And because while you were suffering in that safe, grasping onto hope, fighting every second so you wouldn't lose your humanity...I was happy. I got everything that I wanted, Stefan. I got to be in love, I got the summer of my dreams, I got Bonnie back. So I need to know that this worked. I need to know that it's gonna take away all your suffering. I need to know that you're gonna be okay*. Stefan: I wanted it to be you. When that safe finally opened and somebody found me...I wanted it to be you. I wanted it to be both of you. Lot of people could not picture human Elena saying something like this. I get this pissed a lot of people. I also get that Vampirism brings out what's already there,it amplifies your inner self.I see people hating her a lot for this and saying that she lost her compassion for her friends, there's a lot more but can't post it all. Then I have also seen people questioning her way of reacting to Stefan's death in S5. *Which scene seemed off to you or made you think she was different?* Ps: I don't "hate" Vampire Elena. I personally feel like she was much happier and less depressed but yes, she was different.
